author: Photo EPA; UPG
title: Prosecutors identify Ukrainian prisoners shot by Russians in Zaporizhzhya Region - LB.ua news portal
text: The head of the Department for Combating Crimes Committed in the Context of Armed Conflict of the Prosecutor General's Office, Yuriy Belousov, said that law enforcement officers had identified the names of Ukrainian prisoners of war who were shot by Russian occupiers in Zaporizhzhya Region, Ukrinform [reports](https://www.ukrinform.ua/rubric-ato/3805928-vstanovleni-imena-ukrainskih-polonenih-rozstrilanih-rosianami-na-zaporizzi-ogp.html). "We can confirm the authenticity of the video. We have identified our servicemen who were brutally killed... We have data on a specific brigade and specific names, and they will be exposed soon," Belousov said on Radio Liberty. According to Belousov, law enforcement officers have reason to believe that representatives of the 76th Airborne Division of the Russian Federation, which is known for its war crimes committed in the Kyiv Region, were involved in the killing of Ukrainian POWs. The representative of the Prosecutor General’s office stressed that this case is not isolated and, according to Ukrainian law enforcement, dozens of cases of killing of Ukrainian prisoners of war by Russians have been recorded. "Only during the last month, there was already a case of using our prisoners of war as human shields in the area of this settlement. This indicates the systematic nature of the practice and that this is not an isolated case. The Russian command, whose subordinates are committing these crimes, knows this for sure," Belousov said. He called the shooting of Ukrainian soldiers a cynical violation of the Third Geneva Convention relative to the Treatment of Prisoners of War.

organizations.name: 76th airborne division of the russian federation

author: Redacción
title: Guerra de Ucrania, hoy en directo | Al menos 14 heridos en un nuevo ataque nocturno ruso contra Járkov
text:
En Directo
Minuto a minuto
Guerra de Ucrania, hoy en directo | Al menos 14 heridos en un nuevo ataque nocturno ruso contra Járkov
Las labores de rescate y de apagado de incendios todavía continúan
Redacción
El presidente ruso Vladímir Putin ordenó a sus tropas invadir la vecina Ucrania el 24 de febrero de 2022. Desde entonces, la guerra sigue anclada en el este de Europa. Sigue al minuto las últimas noticias del avance militar de Rusia y de la respuesta de Kiev. Estados Unidos impulsa vías para alcanzar el fin de la guerra. La tregua está más cerca.
Ucrania dice que bajas rusas, entre muertos y heridos, han superado el millón desde 2022
El ministro de Asuntos Exteriores ucraniano, Andrí Sibiga, afirmó este jueves que el número de bajas rusas ha superado el millón, entre muertos y heridos, en los casi tres años y medio desde que empezó la guerra en febrero de 2022. "Un millón perdido para nada: Rusia no ha alcanzado ni uno solo de los objetivos estratégicos de sus objetivos a gran escala. Y no lo hará", aseguró Sibiga en la red social X. El ministro subrayó que Ucrania no comenzó la guerra y quiere "más que nadie" que termine, pero que Rusia está obstaculizando todos los intentos para llegar a una solución negociada del conflicto, rechazando la propuesta de Kiev de un alto el fuego y de una reunión a nivel de presidentes. "Hay que incrementar la presión sobre el agresor", reclamó.
Al menos 14 heridos en un nuevo ataque nocturno ruso contra Járkov
Al menos 14 civiles resultaron heridos este jueves en un ataque nocturno con drones rusos contra la ciudad de Járkov, en el noreste de Ucrania, y la segunda más grande del país después de Kiev, un día después de que murieran tres personas y otras 60 fueran heridas en circunstancias similares. "Por la noche, el enemigo atacó Járkov con drones. Se produjeron incendios en los distritos de Saltivski, Slobodski y Shevchenkivski de la ciudad; ardieron viviendas, locales comerciales y coches. 14 personas fueron heridas, incluidos cuatro niños", informaron los servicios de emergencia del Estado en Telegram. Las labores de rescate y de apagado de incendios todavía continúan.
Sistema de misiles antiaéreos Patriot
Rusia afirmó este miércoles haber recibido aclaraciones de lsrael acerca del supuesto envío de un sistema de misiles antiaéreos Patriot a Ucrania, que le permiten desmentir esta información. "Hemos recibido aclaraciones del Ministerio de Asuntos Exteriores de Israel que indican que estas declaraciones no se corresponden con la realidad", señaló en rueda de prensa la portavoz del Ministerio de Exteriores de Rusia, María Zajárova.
Rusia dice que sus tropas avanzan en la región ucraniana de Dnipropetrovsk
Unidades de dos agrupaciones militares del Ejército ruso avanzan en la región ucraniana de Dnipropetrovsk tras cruzar la frontera de la región de Donetsk, según informó este miércoles el Ministerio de Defensa de este país. "Unidades de la agrupación militar Este salieron a la frontera occidental de la República Popular de Donetsk y están llevando a cabo una ofensiva en el territorio de la región de Dnipropetrovsk", señala la nota castrense. Según el parte militar, en esta dirección los ucranianos contaron con 225 bajas desde el último comunicado durante combates en las localidades de Shevchenko, en la región ucraniana de Donetsk, Guliáipole y Malínovka, en la región de Zaporiyia, a unos 100 kilómetros entre las capitales de ambas regiones.
El presidente de Serbia viaja a Ucrania por primera vez desde el inicio de la invasión rusa
El presidente de Serbia, Aleksandar Vucic, aterrizará este miércoles en Ucrania en la que es su primera visita al país desde que comenzó la invasión rusa del territorio, un viaje que se enmarca en la cumbre que tendrá lugar en la ciudad de Odesa y en la que participarán más de una decena de líderes del sureste de Europa. Así lo ha confirmado la Presidencia serbia en un comunicado, en el que ha matizado que la visita de Vucic, que mantiene buenas relaciones y lazos históricos con Rusia, durará únicamente un día.
Repatrian a Ucrania los restos mortales de más de 1.200 soldados caídos
Los restos mortales de un total de 1.212 soldados ucranianos caídos cuyos cadáveres estaban en manos de las autoridades rusas han sido retornados a Ucrania, según anunció este miércoles en un comunicado el órgano del Estado ucraniano que se ocupa de los prisioneros de guerra. Se trata del primer retorno de cadáveres que se anuncia desde que ucranianos y rusos acordaran el 2 de junio en Estambul canjear los restos mortales de 6.000 soldados de cada bando que están en posesión del enemigo.
Al menos dos muertos y 60 heridos en un nuevo ataque ruso contra Járkov
Al menos dos personas murieron y otras 60 resultaron heridas en un nuevo ataque con drones lanzado anoche por las fuerzas rusas contra la ciudad de Járkov, en el noreste de Ucrania y la segunda más grande del país después de Kiev, según ha informado la Policía ucraniana en un comunicado. Entre los heridos hay, según la fuente, cinco niños, de los que tres han tenido que ser trasladados a un centro médico. Los dos muertos son una mujer de 47 años y un hombre de 65.
Felipe VI llega a Eslovaquia para visitar a las tropas españolas del despliegue de la OTAN ante Rusia
El rey Felipe VI llegó hoy a Eslovaquia para visitar este miércoles a las tropas españolas que lideran la brigada multinacional que la OTAN tiene desplegada en este país como parte de las medidas disuasorias ante Rusia en Europa del Este.
En rey, que llegó a Bratislava acompañado por la ministra de Defensa, Margarita Robles, fue recibido por el presidente eslovaco, Peter Pellegrini, en su residencia oficial en la capital, el Palacio Grassalkovich.
Eslovaquia es miembro de la Alianza desde 2004 y de la Unión Europea (UE) desde 2007.
El ataque ruso contra Kiev provoca daños en una cornisa de la catedral de Santa Sofía
El ataque ruso de anoche contra la capital ucraniana dañó una cornisa de la catedral de Santa Sofía, un monumento histórico protegido por la UNESCO cuyos orígenes se remontan al siglo XI.
Según explicó la directora del complejo que alberga la catedral, el daño sufrido por la cornisa, que fue construida en el siglo XVII, tardará en ser reparado alrededor de un mes y medio.
El daño en el edificio fue causado por la onda expansiva de una de las múltiples explosiones que sacudieron la pasada madrugada el centro y otras zonas de Kiev, debidas a la caída o las interceptaciones de los drones y misiles lanzados por Rusia.
Ucrania evalúa limitar la red móvil para contrarrestar la amenaza de drones rusos
Ucrania estudia introducir restricciones temporales en los servicios de telefonía móvil para perturbar el uso que Rusia hace de las redes móviles ucranianas para recabar información durante los ataques cada vez más masivos con drones, según deliberaciones en el seno de la comisión de Defensa del Parlamento ucraniano.
Los drones rusos de largo alcance, incluidos los Shahed de fabricación iraní, están cada vez más equipados con tarjetas SIM ucranianas de prepago para recoger y transmitir datos críticos durante los vuelos, según informan los expertos que analizan los restos de drones.
Esta inteligencia ayuda a Rusia a perfeccionar sus operaciones con drones y amenaza con hacer sus ataques cada vez más eficaces.

author: Sophie Perry
title: Nativity scene featuring Jesus with two mothers slammed as ‘blasphemous’
text: Nativity scene featuring Jesus with two mothers slammed as ‘blasphemous’ A nativity scene at a church in Italy has been heavily criticised for displaying Jesus as having two mothers, opposed to the traditional Mary and Joseph set up. Father Vitaliano Della Sala – of the Church of Saints Peter and Paul in Capocastello di Mercogliano – defended the depiction, saying the church wishes to showcase and welcome different kinds of families. “I wanted to show with this scene that families are no longer just the traditional ones,” he told Reuters . “In our parishes we see more and more children from the new types of families that exist and are part of our society, children of separated and divorced people, gay couples, single people, young mothers.” Della Sala is well-known as being supportive of the LGBTQ+ community and says he backs Pope Francis’s recent decision to allow the Catholic Church to bless same-sex couples. In a video interview with the news agency, Della Sala added that as priests, they must look at how they “treat these children, the children of these people, the children of these families, and above all, how we treat these families”. You may like to watch “I say we must welcome in the best possible way. We must make them feel at home,” he continued. The display has been blasted by Conservative religious figures in the country, with the Pro-Vita & Famiglia (Pro-Life and Family) group calling it “dangerous, as well as shameful and blasphemous”. Senator Maurizio Gasparri said it “offends all those who always had respect and devotion for the Holy Family”. The backlash over the two-mother display comes amid a crackdown on lesbian mothers in Italy. Far-right and anti-LGBTQ+ prime minister Giorgia Meloni ’s government has sought to crackdown on the rights of LGBTQ+ families since she took office. In July, a list of 33 birth certificates of children born to lesbian couples since 2017 was provided to judges in northern Italy, asking them to strip the names of mothers who did not give birth to the child from the records. author: Feb
title: Examples of Disrespecting Master and Dafa | Falun Dafa - Minghui.org
text:
(Minghui.org) I believe every practitioner understands the importance of respecting Dafa and [Master Li]. Recently, many practitioners have discussed the serious consequences of disrespecting either the Great Law or the founder of Falun Dafa. I would like to share some instances of disrespectful behavior that I have witnessed in the hope that we can all reflect on our conduct and correct any behaviors that do not align with the [Fa].
Chen has endured persecution by the Chinese Communist government, survived two major car accidents, and overcome a severe illness—yet nothing has shaken her faith in Falun Dafa. Fellow practitioners who knew her admired her perseverance.
Recently, I visited her at home twice. The first time, I noticed that [Zhuan Falun] was sitting on the backrest of a dirty sofa in her living room. Considering that she had just lost a loved one, I cleaned the sofa without mentioning my concern. However, when I visited again, I saw that the book was in the same spot. I also noticed that the spine of the book was noticeably darker than the rest, indicating that was where it was frequently touched. At the time, I didn’t think much of it.
After she finished her meal, we read Master’s article How Humankind Came To Be together. I asked her, “Did you wash your hands after you ate?” She said had not and immediately went and washed them. Later, she admitted that she rarely washed her hands before reading Zhuan Falun, except after using the restroom.
She also told me that the local authorities had raided her home many times and always confiscated her Dafa books. Sometimes, however, they didn’t take copies of Minghui Weekly, even when they were in plain sight.
I asked if she had ever considered that it happened because the old forces exploited her disrespect for Dafa books and used it as an excuse to take them away, imprison her, or make her ill.
Bai, who has since passed away due to illness, used to press her thumb on the pages as she read Zhuan Falun, often covering the words. Despite repeated reminders from fellow practitioners not to do that, she dismissed their concerns. Over time, the words near the spine of her book grew fuzzy from her constantly touching them. The pages even bore imprints from her nails and visible spittle marks. She didn’t always wash her hands after using the restroom before continuing to read. When she needed to pause, she would set the open book face down.
Mei, who also passed away due to illness, did not take Fa study seriously and often used her Fa study time to chat with her mother. As soon as she felt sleepy, she would stop reading and go straight to bed. She frequently left her book open, face down, in random places. Some pages even had juice stains on them.
I am not criticizing anyone but rather highlighting the phenomena of disrespecting Dafa and Master. I hope that those in similar situations will take immediate steps to correct their behavior. Of course, I am not implying that disrespecting Dafa is the direct cause of all the persecution practitioners face. However, it is certainly worthy of our attention.
Additionally, for elderly practitioners who live alone, I hope fellow practitioners will kindly remind them if they notice any issues related to disrespecting Dafa or Master.
When I pointed out Bai and Mei’s bad habits to them, I often did so with a blaming tone, which led them to resist my suggestions and continue those habits for a long time. This experience has also made me reflect on how I should offer guidance with kindness rather than as criticism.
Master said in Teaching Given on Lantern Festival Day, 2003:
“... Whether you respect me or not, as your Master, I really, truly don’t mind. Back then, as I was saving you, a lot of you were cursing at me. There were people who were cursing at me even while at my classes. I don’t mind. I just want to save you. (Applause) What I’m trying to say is, personally I don’t mind at all how you treat Master. I’m not affected by any factors at any level of the cosmos. But there’s one problem, which is, if you don’t respect Master, it’s wrong according to the principles of the cosmos, and the old forces will take advantage of the gap and destroy you because of this. They will have seized the biggest excuse to destroy you, since they have seen the entire process of my saving you.
“Whether you treat me well or not, I don’t mind in the least, but the old forces will destroy you in the tribulation. Watch out!”
Let us take Master’s reminder to heart and cultivate with sincerity and respect.
Articles in which cultivators share their understandings typically reflect an individual's perception at a point in time based on their cultivation state, and they are offered in the spirit of enabling mutual elevation.
